newsitem.title: ITALY: Italy bourse index start delayed due to Stet price.
newsitem.headline: Italy bourse index start delayed due to Stet price.

text.p: Quotation of Milan's blue-chip Mib30 index and the all-share Mibtel index has been delayed due to modifications to shares in state telecoms holding Stet.
Stet stock is being modified to take account of the spin-off of yellow pages producer Seat which begins trade on the bourse today.
Both shares have a temporary opening price fluctuation limit of plus or minus five percent, instead of the normal 10 percent.

Cedborsa, the stock market system operator, advised that the calculation and publication of the Mibtel and Mib30 indices would be postponed until the opening of Seat shares to calculate the adjustment coefficient of Stet shares.
A reference price for Seat shares, which were suspended in pre-opening price negotiation for excessive movement, was shown on Cedborsa screens at 612 lire, traders said.

The 612 level is a median between the 490 lire per share initial valuation made by the stock market council late last year and the 800-900 lire quotations for Seat on the grey market in recent days, a council spokesman said.
Seat was indicating a pre-opening price of 550 lire per ordinary share at 0930 GMT.
Stet ordinary shares were indicated at 6450, post-spinoff, compared with Tuesday's close of 6893.
